revised_title: Paramagnetic Resonance Satellites in Calcium Fluoride Impurities
tldr: The authors studied the paramagnetic resonance spectra of impurities in calcium fluoride and discovered satellite lines caused by the simultaneous flipping of the electron spin and a nearby fluorine nuclear spin. They discussed the theory of these transitions and analyzed the satellite structure in the spectrum of one impurity, providing evidence for the presence of a neighboring interstitial fluorine ion.
